instruction: What metric was chosen to estimate plant N status, specifically PNU, PNC, and NNI, and how far can this metric go in assessing the accuracy?
Output:
The metric chosen to evaluate the accuracy of the predictions for PNU (plant nitrogen uptake), PNC (plant nitrogen concentration), and NNI (nitrogen nutrition index) was the Nash-Sutcliffe model efficiency (NSE). This metric measures the agreement between the observed and predicted values, with a value of 1 indicating a perfect match and values closer to 0 indicating poorer agreement.

The NSE values obtained for PNU and NNI ranged between 0.64-0.95 and 0.41-0.92, respectively, for the predictions based on the unmanned aerial vehicle (UAV) data. For the Rapidscan handheld data, the NSE values ranged from 0.60-0.79 for PNU and 0.25-0.79 for NNI. Finally, for the Sentinel-2 spaceborne data, the NSE values ranged from 0.48-0.83 for PNU and 0.42-0.82 for NNI.

The NSE metric provides a measure of the accuracy of the predictions, with higher values indicating better agreement between the observed and predicted values.
